meanings.definition: The act of writing or creating a script together with someone else.
meanings.sent1: In coscripting, two people work together to write a play.
meanings.sent2: The coscripting of the movie involved a team of writers collaborating on the script.
meanings.sent3: During the coscripting session, they realized they both wanted to include a talking dog in the story.
meanings.sent4: Their coscripting was like a dance, each partner seamlessly moving in harmony to create the final script.
meanings.sent5: The coscripting process was so enjoyable that they decided to work on more projects together.

meanings.definition: A collaborative writing process involving multiple authors.
meanings.sent1: Coscripting with a group of writers can lead to a diverse and engaging story.
meanings.sent2: The coscripting for the TV series involved writers from different backgrounds coming together to create the episodes.
meanings.sent3: During the coscripting workshop, the authors shared their favorite writing tips and tricks.
meanings.sent4: Their coscripting was like a puzzle, each author fitting their piece perfectly to complete the script.
meanings.sent5: The coscripting project brought together writers who had never worked together before.
